cube_helper.cube_equaliser module¶

cube_helper.cube_equaliser.equalise_attributes(cubes)[source]¶
Parameters:cubes – Cubes to be equalised
cube_helper.cube_equaliser.remove_attributes(cubes)[source]¶

strips cubes of ALL attributes and metadata. Aux coords should be unaffected. :param cubes: Cubes to be stripped of attributes :return: cubes: after attributes have been removed

cube_helper.cube_equaliser.unify_data_type(cubes)[source]¶

Casts datatypes in iris numpy array to be of the same datatype :param cubes: To be unified in datatypes :return cubes: uniformly cast cubes

cube_helper.cube_equaliser.unify_time_units(cubes)[source]¶
Parameters:cubes – Cubes to be unified

cube_helper.cube_loader module¶

class cube_helper.cube_loader.CubeLoader[source]¶

Bases: object

static load_from_dir(directory, opt_constraint=None, opt_filetype='.nc')[source]¶

Loads a set of cubes from a given directory, single cubes are loaded and appended into an iterable then returned as a CubeList.

Parameters:directory (string) – Directory to load data from
Return iris.CubeList:
 List of cubes loaded from the directory
static load_from_filelist(data_filelist, opt_constraint=None, opt_filetype='.nc')[source]¶

Loads a set of cubes from a given directory, single cubes are loaded and appended into an iterable as well as being loaded into a cubelist.

Parameters:data_filelist (list) – A list of files to load data from
Return iris.Cubelist:
 List of cubes loaded from the list of filenames
